blockchain.name: Arctic Vault
blockchain.desc:
The first artic vault was established in 1984. It holds all your valuables far away from the reach of any tax/debt collector.

Author: J4X

blockchain.name: Frozymarket
blockchain.desc:
Frozymarket is the first prediction market in the arctic. Bet on your favorite hockey team, or get creative creating your own market. The possibilities are endless.

Author: J4X

blockchain.name: drainme
blockchain.desc:
Please buy my shares and be so kind to not steal the other buyer's money!

Author: n4nika

blockchain.name: voteme
blockchain.desc:
I built this super secure governance protocol where any call needs 100% consensus so you won't be able to execute malicious calls, right? RIGHT?

Author: n4nika

crypto.name: AES Overdrive
crypto.desc:
Behold FosLuzzys revolutionary AES upgrade: we've doubled the rounds, squared the security, and exponentially inflated your value as a customer - welcome to the post-quantum cryptographic utopia!

Author: mcsch

crypto.name: Rivest Shamir Adleman Germain
crypto.desc:
My friend Sophie recently told me about this cool encryption algorithm. However she is not sure if it is secure. Can you help her by breaking it?

Author: LosFuzzys

crypto.name: signmeup
crypto.desc:
We improved the Speed of EdDSA; certainly it's way more secure than before.

Author: fanosta

misc.name: FROST
misc.desc:
Fortran Runtime for On-demand Simulation Tasks

Author: xyhlon

misc.name: FindMe
misc.desc:
A friend sent me this pdf, I do not know what he wants me to do with this.

Author: Mucki

misc.name: IcySlide
misc.desc:
mobile

Penguins really enjoy sliding down ice. They can also help you store your files.

Author: LetsFailNoob

misc.name: Korra
misc.desc:
Help the next generation of the Avatar escape the prison

Author: hweissi

misc.name: Schrodinger Compiler
misc.desc:
Flag can contain the following characters: chars = string.ascii_lowercase + string.ascii_uppercase + string.digits + "_{}"

Backup infra: 

Author: ecomaikgolf.com

misc.name: typstastic
misc.desc:
I hate LaTeX, but I found this cool replacement! I hope it's more secure.

Author: ecomaikgolf.com

pwn.name: Genie in an ELF
pwn.desc:
Yesterday, this weird oil lamp-shaped USB stick was laying on the floor, so naturally I've picked it up and responsibly plugged it in. On it there was just a lonely ELF file.

Clumsy as I am, I stumbled into the ELF file and am trapped here with a Genie that calls it their home. Luckily, they granted me to write two bytes wherever to aid my grand escape. Can you help me break out?

Author: huksys

pwn.name: LetterBox
pwn.desc:
Our admin's inbox was overflowing with letters. In order to handle the chaos we have built our very own mail client to efficiently control the chaos.

Author: chr0x6eos

pwn.name: Snow Globe
pwn.desc:
Aaahh, finally November arrived: Trees painted in golden and crimson, their leaves shaken by the cold crispy air; Its chilling cold is heralding the crystalline spectacle of nature that is soon to cover the landscape under a white blanket.

'Tis the service to package your best snapshots into fancy WebP animated snow globes, like magick. Give it a whirl, and you might get out a cool surprise!

Author: huksys

pwn.name: static notes
pwn.desc:
I am DONE with my note apps being pwned by some kidos. Now they are static, blazingly fast and (mostly) secure. I am new to ziglang, so this service is still WIP. Hope you enjoy it though.

Author: PaideiaDilemma

pwn.name: wasmwbw
pwn.desc:
Obligatory Write Byte Where Challenge

Author: PaideiaDilemma

rev.name: Critically Acclaimed
rev.desc:
I wrote this cool and totally original game but someone deleted the source code for my client. Can you help me playtest it anyway?

Author: Riggle

rev.name: Ramo
rev.desc:
"Is this even solveable?" - Ramo

Author: xer0

rev.name: WeirdRedundancy
rev.desc:
As the rev-guy was too busy skating on the ice floes of the distant glacier, the crypto-guy took matters into his own hands and built a challenge himself.

Author: LosFuzzys

rev.name: ksmaze
rev.desc:
22/11/24 @ 22:53 CET: new distribution files + new deployment
    22/11/24 @ 23:01 CET: removed PoW bypass hehe

Fall into the next-generation kernel-optimized maze: /bin/ksmaze

Author: ecomaikgolf.com

rev.name: qamu
rev.desc:
I've always wanted to write my own hardware-accelerated software hypervisor. However, everyone is talking about confidential computing...I am sure I implem ented what they wanted...

Author: Xer0

web.name: Fuzzybytes
web.desc:
I created a website where you can upload files to check for malware. Since I programmed it in my freetime I would ap preciate any donations - and would you also be so kind and try not to hack it? Thanks!

Author: LetsFailNoob

web.name: GlacierChat
web.desc:
We are happy to launch our new GlacierChat this year.

Author: sc0peMa3str0

web.name: SkiData
web.desc:
The owner of the SkiData Platform has challenged you to find out his name! He told you, he has really good opsec, can you prove him wrong?

Author: h4ckd0tm3
